nodes.bodyText:
Please avoid the ! operator. We never know if latestResult has a proper value.
Instead use the ? operator so that it can fail.
Also avoid null and rather use undefined checks (I know this was here before, but we should change it)

nodes.bodyText: refresh sounds like retrieving it from the server, also make sure to add JavaDoc style documentation

another thing: I would also offer this for one submission, then you don't need to wrap submissions in array when calling this method. As there is no overloading for Typescript functions, you need to use two different names
why do we need it twice?

During testing we discoverd that after this.prepareTextBlocksAndFeedbackFor() we need to refresh. Insiede of this.setConflictingSubmission(0); this.prepareTextBlocksAndFeedbackFor() is called again.
Since we have indiviudal refrehs now we can find out which are really necessary. I'll check it
Turns out we don't need it after all, it was only necessary when we still had the map for some reason. I removed the unused updates
what about this remaining TODO?
I missed that one, I removed the funciton and its calls.

please add documentation what this is about and move it below into a new section
// Helper Attributes
make sure to mention that it is undefined except the method below is invoked or it was explicitly set
I added documentation and change latestResult to Result | undefined
also document this one as the attribute that is initialized if the server returns some values
I added documentation to it
please revert this change

nodes.bodyText: its called setLatestSubmissionResult I think
Yea, I changed the comment

Quick Note, the method setLatestSubmissionResult isn't actually used in the code right now, at the moment we just do submission.latestResult = getlatestSubmissionResult(submission);
-> I think we have two option: remove the function, or rewrite the calls of
submission.latestResult = getlatestSubmissionResult(submission); to
setLatestSubmissionResult(submission, getLatestSubmissionResult(submission))
